question: A 33-year-old woman presents to the clinic with pain in her pelvic region. The doctor advises an ultrasound to investigate the cause and it shows a 10 cm, fluid-filled, ovarian cyst. Histopathology shows cyst lined by stratified squamous epithelium with hair, sebaceous glands, and neural tissue. Which of the following neoplasms is most likely?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?
Adding a progestin to the estrogenic component of hormone replacement therapy for postmenopausal women provides which of the following effects?

answers.option: Reduces the risk for endometrial cancer
Provides better control of problematic hot flushes

question: What is the definition of small for gestational age fetuses?

answers.option: Abdominal circumference less than the 10th centile
Weight more than 90th centile for the appropriate gestational age
Weight less than 10th centile for the appropriate gestational age

question: 30-year-old primigravida presents to the clinic for antenatal care at 32 weeks gestation. Her symphysiofundal height (SFH) is 28 cm and her ultrasound shows a baby that is small for gestational age (SGA). What is the definition of such a baby?

answers.option: Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 10th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 90th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 50th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 5th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 70th centile for gestational age

question: A 14-week-old girl's parents are very concerned about her health and brought her to the EPI vaccination center. According to the EPI schedule, which of the following sets of vaccines will she be given?

A 16-year-old girl visited the gynecology outpatient department as she has not started to menstruate. On examination, she is short-statured with a webbed neck and her nipples are widely spaced. Her blood pressure is 110/70 mmHg and her pulse is 82 beats/minute. What is the diagnostic test for her?

A 20-year-old primigravida presents to the obstetrics emergency department at 32 weeks gestation with complaints of constant headache and vision changes that are not relieved by rest or painkillers. She has no known medical problems. She is noted to have a blood pressure of 150/110 mmHg and her urine dipstick shows 2+ proteinuria. She is advised for admission and observation of her blood pressure and related workup. and management What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?
A 22-year-old female came to the clinic for a pap smear. Her results showed mild dyskaryosis and dysplasia involving less than 1/3 of the basal membrane. What is the next step in this case?

answers.option: Large loop excision of transformation zone (LLETZ)

question: A 22-year-old female comes to your clinic complaining of a mass in her right breast. She denies smoking and has no family history of breast cancer. Her history reveals a road traffic accident 2 weeks ago. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old woman passes grape-like masses in the 16th week of pregnancy. She had left fetal movement. On examination, she measured 18 weeks uterus. Dilatation and curettage (D&C) is performed. Histopathology exam shows large avascular villi along with trophoblast proliferation. Which of the following is the best method to employ her follow-up care?

A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge for the past three days. On pelvic examination, the discharge is white in color and has a foul fishy odor. She is diagnosed with bacterial vaginosis. Which of the following is/are the most appropriate choice of medication(s) for bacterial vaginosis?

A 24-year-old primigravida came in the outpatient department at 30 weeks of gestation with a complaint of headache. On examination, her blood pressure is 140/190 mmHg and urine D/R shows no proteinuria. What would be the most likely diagnosis?

A 25 year-old-woman, P2+0, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with the complaint of lower abdominal pain and foul-smelling vaginal discharge for the last 1 week. She had a copper intra-uterine device inserted 6 months ago. On abdominal examination, there is tenderness, and on pelvic examination, purulent discharge is noticed coming out from the cervix. What will be the best management option for this patient?

answers.option: Admit the patient and give IV antibiotics
Offer oral antibiotics for 14 days and then reassess
Send the culture and offer oral antibiotics for 14 days then reassess
Send the culture and reassure the patient

question: A 25-year-old lady, para 2+0, presents to the clinic at 26 weeks gestation. Her first baby is alive and the second was a preterm delivery of a baby with hydrops fetalis. The patient’s blood group is A negative and her husband is B positive. The patient did not receive anti-D after any of her pregnancies. Cordocentesis will be helpful in the assessment of which of the following disorders?

A 25-year-old woman comes to the gynecology outpatient department with the complaint of inability to conceive. She has been married for 8 months. Her husband is a 28-year-old nonsmoker with no known comorbidities. She has a normal body mass index. She has regular periods with no known comorbidities. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this couple?

answers.option: Explain to her what the fertile window is and recommend regular intercourse for one year

question: A 25-year-old woman is diagnosed with subserosal fibroids. She is married and wishes to soon start a family. What is the best treatment plan for her?

A 25-year-old woman, G1P0, presents for her regular antenatal checkup at the 24th week of pregnancy. Her serum hemoglobin level is 8.9 g/dL. She was diagnosed with thalassemia minor during her childhood. What is the next step in her antenatal management?

A 26-year-old female, gravida 2, para 0+1 presents to the emergency department with the complaint of right iliac fossa pain. The patient has a history of appendectomy 2 years back and left-sided salpingectomy due to ectopic pregnancy 3 years back. On examination, she is hemodynamically unstable. On ultrasound, her uterine cavity is empty, and a right adnexal mass of 4 x 3 cm is noted. Her beta-HCG is 2800 mIU/mL. Which of the following is the most appropriate management in this case?

A 26-year-old primigravida is admitted to the labor room at 38 weeks of gestation. She is having regular painful uterine contractions for 6 hours, 2 in 10 minutes each lasting for 20 seconds. Fetal heart rate is regular at 150 beats per minute. On vaginal examination, the cervix is 6 cm dilated, 60% effaced, and the vertex is at -1 station. What would be the next step in her management?

A 27-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of bloody discharge from her right nipple. On examination, she is afebrile, and a mass is palpable on her right breast. The doctor orders a mammogram which shows a solitary subareolar nodule with dilation of the ducts. A biopsy of the lesion shows a central fibrovascular core, extending from the walls of the duct, occupying the lumen and lined by myoepithelial cells. Which of the following conditions is the likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old female, G3 P1+1 is brought to the emergency department with severe lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding for the past 3 hours. She is currently at the 10+3rd week of gestation. Ultrasound abdomen reveals an adnexal mass with serum beta-hcG levels of 5178 mIU/ml. She previously had an ectopic pregnancy and underwent a salpingectomy for it. What is the treatment of choice in this case?

A 28-year-old nulliparous woman came in out-patient-department with a complaint of inability to conceive for 4 years. She has regular menstrual cycles. She has a history of appendectomy 2 years back. What could be the likely cause of her sub fertility from the following?

A 28-year-old nulliparous woman comes to the outpatient department with inability to conceive for three years. She has a history of pelvic inflammatory disease treated two years ago. Which of the following is the gold standard test for tubal pregnancy?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of inability to conceive for the last 4 years. She has regular menstrual cycles and has a past surgical history of appendectomy 2 years back. What is the likely cause of her infertility?

A 29-year-old married lady presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of left breast swelling for the past 4 months. Family history is positive for breast and ovarian malignancy. On local examination, a large ulcerated swelling measuring 15x12x10 cm is detected in the left breast. The mass was firm to soft in consistency, emitting putrid-smelling discharge, non-tender to touch, and bosselated leaf-like appearance with erythema of surrounding skin. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-day-old female child, delivered by a lower segment cesarean section at 38 weeks of gestation is brought to the emergency room with a complaint of brownish discoloration of urine. On examination, she has a palpable mass in the right flank. Her mother has a history of pre-gestational diabetes. Birth weight is 4.0 kg, length 55 cm. CBC: Hb 22 gm/dl TLC: 15,000 platelets 75000/microliter. Urine detailed report shows numerous red blood cells. What is the most likely cause of this problem?

A 32-year-old female, gravida 2 para 1 presents to the maternity clinic for her antenatal visit. She has a mitral valve replacement done previously. Which department will be particularly involved in her antenatal care?

A 32-year-old woman, P2+0, last born six months back, presents to the gynaecology clinic with amenorrhea for three months. She has a history of irregular periods for six months and weight gain for five months. She is breastfeeding her baby and her body mass index is normal. Which of the following investigations will you advise her?

A 34-year-old woman Mrs. ABC, gravida 2, para 1+0 presents to the antenatal clinic at 12 weeks of pregnancy. She gives a history of 1 Down syndrome baby and now she has come to discuss prenatal testing in the current pregnancy. Which of the following tests has the highest detection rate for screening for Down syndrome?

A 34-year-old woman, para 2+0, visits the gynecology department with an ultrasound report showing an intramural fibroid 7x7 cm. She is not willing to undergo surgery and wishes to retain her fertility. After discussion, she opts for uterine artery embolization. Which of the following specialists performs uterine artery embolization?
A 35-year-old woman, para 4+0, presents with second-degree uterovaginal prolapse two months after the delivery of her last baby. What will be the appropriate treatment option for her?

A 40-year-old female presents with a palpable breast mass of 2 cm. Mammography shows calcifications and a radiopaque mass. On biopsy, there is an increased number of acini that are compressed and distorted in the central portion of the lesion, in a fibrous stroma. Preserved double layer of the epithelium is present in immunohistochemistry. No nuclear atypia is identified. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old lady P3+0, previous normal deliveries, known diabetic, presented to the clinic with complaints of heavy and painful periods for 2 years. Abdominal examination is unremarkable. On pelvic examination, the uterus is soft, 10-week size, and tender, both fornices were clear. Pelvic ultrasound shows an endometrial thickness of 12 mm with a boggy uterus, diffused endometrium, and normal ovaries. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old lady, P3+0, with no previous normal deliveries, a known diabetic, presented to you in the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy and painful periods for two years. Abdominal examination is unremarkable. On pelvic examination, the uterus is soft, 10 weeks in size, and tender, both fornices were clear. Pelvic ultrasound shows an endometrial thickness of 12 mm with a bulky uterus, diffusely thickened endometrium, and normal ovaries. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old, para 5+0, known case of diabetes, presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of vaginal discharge and itching. Per vaginal examination reveals a thick white curdy discharge. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 46-year-old male patient presents with urinary obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination shows that the patient has prostatic enlargement and is diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia. The physician decides to start finasteride. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of finasteride?

answers.option: Reducing LH secretion from pituitary hence reducing the testosterone synthesis
Having dual inhibitory effects on LH secretion from pituitary and testosterone synthesis from testes
Lowering circulating as well as prostatic dihydrotestosterone concentration
Blocking testosterone receptors in the prostate gland

question: A 47-year-old multiparous woman presented to the gynecology outpatient department for increasing secondary dysmenorrhea and heavy menstrual bleeding. On per vaginal examination, the uterus is tender and enlarged. Ultrasound shows a large uterus of 11 cm without any mass. Which of the following can be used to make a definitive diagnosis of her problem?

A 50-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of bloody discharge from the nipples and swelling in her right breast. On examination of the breast, a lump can be felt in the subareolar region and there is ulceration over the nipple. The physician orders a biopsy, which shows that the tumor is HER2 positive. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with heavy menstrual bleeding and weight loss. On examination, pallor is present but jaundice is not. Per abdominal: Uterus is enlarged with irregular margins and restricted mobility, no palpable lymph nodes. Vaginal examination: the uterus is of 18 weeks in size, irregular margins, fornices clear. Her endometrial biopsy confirms endometrial carcinoma. Her MRI done shows a 6 cm by 7 cm irregular mass in the uterine cavity invading the myometrium and cervix. There is no breach of serosa or involvement of adnexa or enlarged lymph nodes. What is the appropriate surgical approach considering her MRI?

answers.option: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

question: A 55-year-old female presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding. When she was 48 years old, she was diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia on biopsy. However, she never returned for follow-up and never received treatment. Which of the following conditions is the most likely cause of her abnormal bleeding?

A 55-year-old postmenopausal lady presents in the outpatient department with a complaint of heaviness in her abdomen for the last 4 months. She feels full quickly after small meals and also feels easily fatigued on mild to moderate physical activity. She also complains of constipation off and on. On per abdominal examination, the abdomen is distended with a dull percussion note and a mass is also felt extending up to the umbilicus which is soft in consistency. It has limited mobility and its lower limit can not be reached. All of these findings are suggestive of which of the following diagnoses?

A 62-year-old female has been in menopause for 2 years. She is a known diabetic on insulin. On examination, her body mass index is 31 kg/m2. She presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of two episodes of post-menopausal bleeding. Which of the following should be included in her initial investigations?

A baby delivered at 38 weeks of gestation by an emergency cesarean section did not establish respiration after birth. After stimulation and drying, the baby was given positive pressure ventilation. The most appropriate indicator for effective ventilation is:
A baby is delivered at a low birth weight of 1.5 kg. Which complication is the baby at a high risk of?
A baby is delivered with skin covered by a greenish material. What is the potential complication?

A five-month-old boy is brought to a pediatric outpatient department with 3 days of fever, loose stools, and vomiting. He is also having convulsions. According to the IMNCI guidelines, what is the appropriate classification of this illness?

A mother has brought her 19-year-old daughter into the outpatient department with a history of inability to menstruate. The patient has two siblings with normal menstrual cycles. There is a history of coarctation of the aorta, other history is not significant. On examination, she has a short stature and, a wide carrying angle, and her ultrasound pelvis shows streak ovaries. Her Hb is 8 g/dl and FSH is 60 mIU/mL. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?
A pregnant woman is diagnosed with gestational diabetes and has an HbA1C level of >85 mmol/mol. What is the risk of fetal mortality?
A woman who had previously undergone a hysterectomy presents with prolapse from the vagina. What is this type of prolapse called?
A yolk sac tumor has which histopathological finding?

A young lady presents with irregular vaginal bleeding. She is concerned for her health because her mother had cervical carcinoma. The gynecologist advises a pap smear testing which reveals cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia is strongly associated with which of these?

About 10-month-old Farah is brought to the pediatric clinic with a complaint of cough for 3 days. The child is febrile but taking feed well. Her respiratory rate is 72 breaths per minute but no chest in-drawing. According to integrated management of childhood and neonatal illnesses guidelines (IMNCI), she will be classified as which of the following?
According to the latest classification by the World Health Organisation (WHO), how many categories of endometrial hyperplasia are recognized?

An 80-year-old woman presents with third-degree vaginal prolapse. She is also positive for hepatitis C and her coagulation profile is deranged. Which of the following is the most suitable treatment for her?
Breast milk is produced as a result of the action of hormones and reflexes. Which of the following is the milk-secreting hormone?
In Integrated Management of Newborn and Childhood Illness (IMNCI), a 10-month-old child will be labeled as having fast breathing if his/ her respiratory rate is above which of the following?
In the expanded program of immunization (EPI), which vaccine is ideally administered at 6 weeks of age in a newborn?

answers.option: Rotavirus, pneumococcal, pentavaccine, oral polio vaccine

question: Maternal death is defined as the death of a woman from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management but not from accident or incident while pregnant or within how many days/months of termination of pregnancy?
Primordial germ cells arise in which of the following?
Spermatocytic seminoma differs from classic seminoma as the former shows which of the following features?
Spiral arteries become more convoluted, endometrium growth occurs, and fluid secretion begins. What phase of the menstrual cycle is this?

The Integrated Management of Neonatal and Childhood Illness (IMNCI) classifies children under five into two age categories for case management: (A) from birth up to 2 months and (B) children aged 2 months up to 5 years. In IMNCI, the age group of children from birth to 2 months is labeled as?
The World Health Organization classifies endometrial hyperplasia into how many categories?
The death of a mother during pregnancy or within 42 days of birth is termed as which of the following?

The doctor has just delivered a child of an 18-year-old woman (G1 para 0), who is pre-eclamptic. Her uterus is soft with moderate to heavy bleeding. Examination reveals no laceration. What is the most common cause of postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)?
The low grade serous carcinoma of the ovary carry highest frequency of mutation in which of the following genes?
What is the Tanner stage associated with the breast having a secondary mound?
What is the cause of hirsutism in a patient with polycystic ovarian syndrome?
What is the correct terminology for children under 28 days of age?
What is the most common cause of maternal mortality in Pakistan?
What is the most debilitating complication expected in a neonate who is untreated with serum bilirubin 22 mg/dl and indirect 18 mg/dl on 1st day of life?
What is the range for average birth weight in developing countries?
What is the worst prognosis of oligohydramnios?
What makes estrogen and progesterone contraceptives?

answers.option: Estrogen antagonizes the effect of progestin

question: Which of the following conditions associated with oligohydramnios has the worst fetal outcomes?
Which of the following conditions is the most closely associated with endometrial hyperplasia?
Which of the following is a major synthetic estrogen?
Which of the following is also known as Bowen's disease?
Which of the following is not a therapeutic use of estrogen?
Which of the following is not commonly used for the treatment of hirsutism?
Which of the following is the best indicator of chronic fetal hypoxia?
Which of the following is the common cause of hematosalpinx?
Which of the following is the confirmatory procedure to ascertain breech presentation in a pregnancy?
Which of the following is the cut-off for fast breathing in a child who is 2 to 12 months old, according to IMNCI?
Which of the following is the mechanism of action of finasteride?

answers.option: Increase the serum levels of androstendione
Increase the serum levels of testosterone

question: Which of the following symptoms is likely to occur in the intermediate period of 3-10 years after menopause?
Which of the following vaccines of the expanded program on immunization (EPI) schedule is administered intradermally?
Yolk sac tumor has which of the following histopathological features?
26-year-old primigravida comes to the outpatient department at 25 weeks gestation with absent liquor. What investigation is advised?

48-year-old Mrs. ABC, para 5+0, menopausal for 18 months, comes to the gynaecology outpatient department with complaints of hot flashes, mood swings, bone pains, and loss of libido. She is a known case of diabetes and inherited thrombophilia, and suffers from migraine. What is the absolute contraindication for the use of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) in this woman?

A 1-week-old neonate presents with irritability, poor feeding, and fever for 3 days. Physical examination reveals a respiratory rate of 72 breaths/minute with a bulging fontanelle. Mother had a history of leakage of amniotic fluid 24 hours before delivery. What is the most likely cause of neonatal illness?

A 1-year-old child presents to the clinic with a complaint of cough for the past three days. On examination, he is afebrile and no subcostal recessions are observed. He is able to breastfeed as per usual. What is the classification of this child's disease according to IMNCI?

A 1.5-year-old child presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of cough for the past four days. On examination, he is afebrile, his respiratory rate is 30 breaths per minute, and no chest indrawing and stridors are observed. He can breastfeed as per usual. What is the classification of this child's disease according to IMNCI?
A 10-year-old child has been wetting the bed for years and has been wearing diapers since birth. What is the likely cause?
A 12-week pregnant woman presents with vaginal bleeding and abdominal pain. On examination, the cervical os is closed and the fetal heartbeat is present. What is the ideal management?

A 13-year-old girl is brought by her mother to the clinic with concerns that she has no commenced her periods yet. On examination, she is a healthy 13-year-old with normal secondary sexual characteristics. A limited pelvic exam reveals a blind-ending vagina with an ultrasound abdomen revealing an absent uterus. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of not having started menstruation. Her elder sisters had their periods at the age of 13. On examination, the external genitals are normal. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 15-year-old girl is brought to the physician by her mother. The mother complains that her daughter has been experiencing mood swings and a lack of concentration. The girl is diagnosed with premenstrual syndrome. What is the best way to start treatment?

A 15-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department for the assessment of delayed puberty. She is developmentally normal. On examination, she is at Tanner’s stage 1. What will be the most appropriate management of this patient's condition?

A 15-year-old girl presents with complaints of increasing abdominal pain, vaginal swelling, and pain during micturition. Her breast development is normal but she has not begun to menstruate. On observation of the genitalia, a tense blue swelling at the level of the hymen is seen. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old unmarried female presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of bleeding from her gums and heavy menstrual bleeding since menarche. On examination, she is pale, and her abdomen is soft and non-tender. Which of the following is the most suitable examination in this case?

A 16-year-old boy suffers from 5α-reductase enzyme deficiency. He was raised as a girl but at puberty, male secondary sex characteristics appeared, and male genital growth occurred. The level of which of the following hormones was reduced as a result of this deficiency until puberty?

A 16-year-old comes to the clinic who is phenotypically female. Further history and examination reveal that the genitalia is ambiguous, there is primary amenorrhea, the testes are undescended, female reproductive organs are absent but gynecomastia is present. Karyotyping confirms that she is genotypically male. What is the possible diagnosis?

A 16-year-old female presents to the gynecology clinic with a complaint of primary amenorrhea. Her height is 154 cm, and her body mass index is 24 kg/m². On examination, she has normal secondary sexual characteristics. Investigations reveal normal FSH, LH, and estrogen levels. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 16-year-old obese girl presented with mild hirsutism and oligomenorrhea. She was advised for lifestyle modification and exercise to achieve a normal body mass index. What is the beneficial effect of weight reduction in her case?

answers.option: Decreased sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) & increased free testosterone
Decreased sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) & decreased free testosterone
Increased sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) & decreased free testosterone

question: A 16-year-old unmarried girl presents to the gynecology outpatient department as she has not started her menstruation yet. Her secondary sexual characteristics are well-developed according to her age. Her body mass index is normal. She has had cyclical lower abdominal pain for one and a half years. On examination, a mass of about 16 weeks is palpable in the lower abdomen, and on inspection, a tense bluish bulge at the hymen is seen. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis for this patient?

A 16-year-old unmarried girl presents to the gynecology outpatient department as she has not started her menstruation yet. Her secondary sexual characteristics are well-developed according to her age. Her body mass index is normal. She has had cyclical lower abdominal pain for one and a half years. On examination, a mass of about 16 weeks is palpable in the lower abdomen, and on inspection, a tense bluish bulge at the hymen is seen. Which of the following is the most important investigation for her?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with the complaint of sudden onset of pain in the left testicle radiating to the upper abdomen. He also complains of nausea and vomiting since the onset of pain. On examination, a high-riding left testis is found. Phrens sign is negative. Which of the following measures must be taken in this case?

A 17-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding and irregular menstrual cycles for the past year. Her physical examination is unremarkable. All her laboratory results are within normal range. Which of the following causes will cause such a presentation in this age group?

A 17-year-old girl presents to the clinic with a complaint of excess body hair. Her laboratory results show no significant findings. Her BMI is 24 kg/m2 and her blood pressure is normal. Which of the following is the likely cause of the excessive hair growth in this patient?

A 19-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and pubic hairs but the uterus and vagina are absent. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 19-year-old female presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of abnormal hair growth and weight gain. She has normal serum insulin levels and her menstrual cycles are regular. What is the treatment of choice for hirsutism in this patient?

A 19-year-old tall girl presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of primary amenorrhea. On examination, pubic and axillary hair is sparse, and genitalia are ambiguous. On ultrasound, the uterus is absent. Her karyotype is XY. What can be the cause of the primary amenorrhea?

A 19-year-old unmarried female presents to the clinic complaining of severe hirsutism. Her body mass index is 26 kg/m². Her ultrasound abdomen and pelvis are normal. Her serum FSH is 4.4 IU/L, and her serum LH is 16 IU/L. What is the most appropriate investigation to perform next in this patient?

A 2-day-old baby is brought to the emergency room with complaints of fever, cough, chills, fast breathing with grunting or wheezing sounds, and vomiting. The neonate develops subsequent sepsis. Which of the following is the most common causative organism of neonatal pneumonia?

A 2-day-old baby presents with jaundice noticed on the first day of life. On examination, the baby has fair reflexes, and the jaundice is up to the ankles. The mother's blood group is A- and that of the baby is A+. What is the most appropriate investigation to confirm the diagnosis of this patient?

A 2-day-old neonate is brought to the emergency room with a complaint of fever and cough. On examination, the child is febrile, toxic-looking with tachypnea, and chest indrawings. What is the most probable diagnosis of this patient?

A 2-year-old girl presents with an ovarian mass. Laboratory tests show a markedly raised level of alpha-fetoprotein. Microscopy of the growth shows a tumor composed of cuboidal cells in a lace-like pattern with numerous glomeruloid structures. Which of the following statements is true regarding this tumor?

answers.option: Most likely diagnosis in this scenario is choriocarcinoma
In boys, this tumor is called a seminoma
Glomeruloid structures are called Schiller-Duval bodies
This is a type or teratoma
It usually has a benign course

question: A 20-day-old neonate, weighing 4.5 kg, is brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of abnormal position of the right upper limb. The mother has a history of diabetes during pregnancy. On examination, the arm is abducted and internally rotated with the pronated forearm. Biceps reflex and Moro reflex are absent on the right side. What is the most likely cause of his symptoms?

answers.option: Injury of the 5th and 6th cervical roots
Injury of the 7th and 8th cervical roots

question: A 20-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of irregular menstrual cycles for the past three months. She also complains that she has noticed an increased growth of hair on her face. Her BMI is 32 kg/m². Which of the following is the most appropriate initial drug of choice for this patient?

A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with lower abdominal pain for three weeks. Ultrasound of her pelvis shows a left ovarian cyst containing hair and teeth. What is the probable diagnosis?
A 20-year-old female was diagnosed with a hydatidiform mole. Which histologic feature would differentiate a partial hydatidiform mole from a complete hydatidiform mole?

A 20-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of a painless palpable lump on her breast for the last 8 months. It is firm, mobile, and non-tender. What is the diagnosis of this case?
A 20-year-old male came with swelling of left testis for 1 year. Based on morphology, spermatocytic seminoma can be differentiated from seminoma by the presence of which of the following?

A 20-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of swelling in his left scrotum. Upon further inquiry, he reveals that the swelling came to his notice after a baseball game during which he suffered some trauma to the scrotal region. On examination, the swelling is non-tender, and firm and does not transilluminate on the transillumination test. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male presents with a soft, rubbery growth on his testis. The tumor is homogenous, lobulated, and gray-white on the cut surface. Serological markers are negative. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 20-year-old primigravida presented to the emergency department with sudden-onset hypertension. Which of the following is the defect that is responsible for preeclampsia?

A 20-year-old unmarried nulliparous female presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy menstrual bleeding. On ultrasound, two intramural fibroids measuring 8x12 cm are seen. What is the appropriate treatment for this patient?
A 20-year-old woman develops a left-sided ovarian mass. Workup for malignancy reveals a tumor that over-expressed the receptor tyrosine kinase, KIT. Which of these is the odd one out for this tumor?

answers.option: Sheets of cells with clear cytoplasm

question: A 20-year-old woman has multiple sex partners. She has a fever and left lower quadrant abdominal pain with onset in association with her menstrual period since the last two cycles. The pap smear and culture show Neisseria gonorrhoeae growth. Diagnosis of gonococcal pelvic inflammatory disease is made. What is the common sequela of this infection?

A 20-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a history of amenorrhea for 4 months and per vaginal bleeding. On ultrasound, she has a large placenta and a gestational sac. A suction evacuation is performed. Karyotyping of the villi reveals a triploid karyotype. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 20-year-old, G2 para 1, previously had a normal delivery and came into labor with 7 cm dilation and extended breech presentation. The baby's size is average and there are no other risk factors. Which is the first step to deliver the head of the baby after the delivery of body?

A 21-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of vaginal discharge. On per speculum examination, a red and inflamed cervix is seen. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of pelvic inflammatory disease?

A 22-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge for 3 months associated with lower abdominal pain. On examination, her cervix is covered with a mucopurulent discharge. What is the investigation of choice for this patient?

A 22-year-old woman requests emergency contraception after unprotected intercourse that occurred 1 day ago. She has no medical conditions. Which of the following agents is the most appropriate?

answers.option: Thickening of the cervical mucous plug

question: A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of irregular menstrual bleeding for the past three months. On examination, the abdomen is non-tender and a mass of 12 weeks in size can be palpated. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this patient?

question: A 23-year-old married female presents with the complaint of abrupt onset of heavy vaginal bleeding for the past 2 hours. answers.option: Advise bedrest and call her for follow up in 2 weeks
Refer her to a general surgeon as she does not have a gynecological problem
Give her an appointment at the antenatal clinic near her home
Ask her to go home and drink plenty of fluids
Perform emergency surgery for ruptured ectopic pregnancy

question: A 23-year-old married lady presents with the complaint of repeated bouts of cyclical lower abdominal pain for the last 6 months. question: A 23-year-old unmarried female presents to the clinic with complaints of the prolonged menstrual cycle, weight gain, and hirsutism. Her body mass index is 35 kg/m². What is the first-line treatment in this case?

Cordocentesis can be performed around 10 weeks of gestation
Amniocentesis can be done around 10 weeks of gestation

question: A 23-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with complaints of vaginal bleeding and grape-like cysts passing through the vagina. She also states that she is 8 weeks pregnant. question: A 24-year-old gravida 2 para 1+0 comes for a checkup at the 28th week of gestation. Her symphysis-fundal height (SFH) measures 24 cm. How should fetal growth be further assessed?

answers.option: Performing US for cervical lengths or offering her cerclage on basis of her history and managing her in tertiary setup
Give routine antenatal care and just tocolyse once in labor

Gestational sac diameter more than 20 mm with no fetal pole

Refer her to tertiary care center

question: A 29-year-old woman G1P0 at 18 weeks gestation presents to the clinic with complaints of grape-like mass discharge from her vagina for the past 8 days. Ultrasound of the pelvis shows snowstorm appearance. What is the diagnosis?
A 29-year-old woman G1P0 presented to the emergency with a headache, blurred vision, and edema. Her blood pressure is 138/90 mmHg. What is your most likely diagnosis?

A 29-year-old woman G2P1 29 weeks gestation comes to the emergency room with severe headache and edema. Her blood pressure is 160/100. CNS examination revealed decreased visual acuity and an altered level of consciousness. What is your provisional diagnosis?

A 29-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of abnormal hair growth and irregular menstrual periods. She has not had her period for 2 months. She has 1 child who is 8 months old. What is the preferred treatment for this patient?

A 29-year-old woman, 5 days post-partum, presents to the clinic with the complaint of painful breasts. Examination shows cracks and fissures on the nipple and the breast is warm to touch. Which organism is most probably responsible for this?

A 29-year-old woman, G2P1, comes into the clinic for her routine antenatal checkup at 32 weeks of gestation with ultrasound reports showing mild polyhydramnios. She also has a history of gestational diabetes. Which of the following investigations would be advised by the doctor?
A 3-day-old baby presents with jaundice at the 25th hour of his life. What investigations must be carried out to find out the cause of his jaundice?

answers.option: This is physiologic jaundice and requires no investigations

question: A 3-week-old infant presents with jaundice persisting for 3 days. On examination, the gallbladder is non-palpable. The infant has clay-coloured stools, dark urine, and an enlarged liver. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old child presents with dehydration following diarrhea for three days. The child is irritable, has sunken eyes, skin pinch goes back very slowly. What will be the appropriate management of this child according to IMNCI?

A 3-year-old child, Aslam, is brought to the under-5 clinic with a 3-day history of high-grade fever with rigors, loose stools with blood, daily one to two vomiting, and decreased appetite. Yesterday, he had convulsions lasting for 2 minutes but since then no more such events occurred. According to IMNCI, what is the danger sign here?

answers.option: History of convulsions in present illness

question: A 30-year-old female nulliparous married for 3 years visited an outpatient department for her fertility issues. She has a regular menstrual cycle and found nothing remarkable on her examination. Her husband's semen analysis report is normal. What would be the appropriate investigation to confirm ovulation?
A 30-year-old female presents for her regular visit with her previous pap smear report which reveals mild dyskaryosis. What is the appropriate next step?
A 30-year-old female presents to the clinic with abdominal distension for 4 days. She is a known case of mucinous cystadenoma. What investigation would you advise?

A 30-year-old female presents to the labor room at the 38th week of gestation with regular painful uterine contractions 4/10 lasting for 40-50 seconds each. Pelvic examination reveals effacement with 3-4 cm dilation. Examination 2 hours later reveals similar findings, and an emergency lower-segment cesarean section is performed. What is the diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female, P0+0, is brought to the emergency department with a complaint of lower abdominal pain for 2 days, which has now worsened. She also experienced a brief spell of unconsciousness at home. Her pulse is 140 beats per minute and her blood pressure is 80/40 mmHg. The abdomen is tender on palpation and some fullness is felt. Her last menstrual period was 35 days back. Her urine pregnancy test is positive. Immediate resuscitation with IV fluid is started and her ultrasound pelvis shows a uterus of normal size. A moderate amount of fluid is seen in the pelvis and peritoneal cavity with a heterogeneous area of about 5 x 4 x 3 cm in the right adnexa, adjacent to the ovary. Which of the following is the appropriate management option for this patient?

answers.option: Medical management with a chemotherapeutic agent

question: A 30-year-old grand multipara delivered her baby at home with the assistance of a midwife. Four hours post-delivery, she presents to the emergency department with tachypnoea, tachycardia, hypotension, and severe bleeding. Which of the following is the first step in the management of postpartum haemorrhage?

A 30-year-old gravida 3 para 1+1 presents to a clinic for a routine check-up at 20 weeks of gestation. She has a history of hypertension for ten years. Her recent ultrasound reveals asymmetrical fetal growth restriction. Which of the following is the most likely cause of fetal compromise?

A 30-year-old lady G2P1+0, married since 4 years presented in the outpatient department at 32 weeks of gestation with ultrasound reports showing mild polyhydramnios. Which of the following is a preventable cause of polyhydramnios?

A 30-year-old lady, G4P3+0, previous normal deliveries, known diabetic presented to the outpatient department for routine antenatal visit at 33 weeks of gestation. On examination, her vitals are within normal range. On abdominal examination, her symphysio-fundal height is 30 cm with fetal heart sound of 132 breaths per minute. Her ultrasound showed normal fetus of an age of 30 weeks, normal amniotic fluid index, and doppler studies showed normal waveform pattern of umbilical vessels. What is most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old lady, Mrs. ABC, married for 3 years, came with a complaint of failure to conceive since marriage. She has had heavy menstrual bleeding and lower abdominal pain for one year. On per abdominal examination, she has a pelvic mass of around 18 weeks size. Pelvic ultrasound showed a fibroid of 12 × 10 cm in the fundal region. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

A 30-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with swelling in his right scrotum for the past two weeks. On examination, the swelling is non-tender, firm, and does not transilluminate. A biopsy reveals glomeruli-like structures and immunohistochemical staining is positive for alpha-fetoprotein. Which of the following statements is most appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: Glomeruli-like structures are called exner bodies
In adults it occurs along with embryonal carcinoma
The tumor cells consist of syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast cells
It consists of sheets of undifferentiated cells with primitive glandular differentiation
It has a poor prognosis in infants and up to 3 years of age

question: A 30-year-old male presents with a mass on the testis. Histopathology of the tumor reveals large multinucleated giant cells and mononuclear cells showing extensive hemorrhage and necrosis. What is the origin of these cells?

A 30-year-old male, matriculate, electric technician, married for 2 years is referred to you for assessment of underlying psychological causes for not consummating his marriage. He has no past medical or surgical history. His physical examination and relevant laboratory investigations are also normal. On assessment, he is found to be anxious and used to setting high expectations in achieving any goal since earlier. He has a supportive partner and no obvious stressors. Which of the following factors is most likely responsible for his reproductive dysfunction?

A 30-year-old married woman presents to the gynecology out-patient department with a complaint of foul-smelling vaginal discharge and itching for the last 2 weeks. She is a non-diabetic. On speculum examination, there is a homogenous white vaginal discharge. A probable diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis is made. Which of the following is not an Amsel's criteria to diagnose bacterial vaginosis?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female married for 8 years attended gynaecology out-patient-department with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding and generalized weakness for the last 6 months. She looks pale, pelvic examination shows a mass of about 20 weeks size, firm in consistency. Her Hb is 4.3. Ultrasound shows a solitary intramural fibroid of about 7*8 cm. She is very much concerned about her sub fertility because her marriage is at risk. What would be the immediate step in her treatment?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female, married for 3 years, had a cervical biopsy for an abnormal cervical smear. Her histopathology shows micro-invasive cervical cancer with horizontal spread <7 mm, and depth of stromal invasion <3mm. What is the most appropriate treatment option for her?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female, married for 3 years, presents to the clinic with a complaint of not being able to conceive. Her periods and hormonal profile are normal. Her husband's semen analysis is normal. Hysterosalpingography reveals bilaterally blocked fallopian tubes. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

A 30-year-old pregnant female, G4, P3+0, comes to the emergency with complaints of 34 weeks of pregnancy with per vaginal bleeding and abdominal pain for one hour. On examination, blood pressure is 140/90 mm of Hg, the abdomen is tense and tender, heart rate is 140/min. On per vaginal examination, the cervical os is closed, and profuse per vaginal bleeding is observed. What is the most appropriate first step of management for her?

answers.option: Induction of labor with prostaglandin E2
Artificial rupture of membrane and augmentation with oxytocin

question: A 30-year-old primigravida comes to the outpatient department at 35 weeks gestation with a complete blood count (CBC) revealing a platelet count of 40,000. She has a known history of immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP). What is the next step in the management of this patient?

A 30-year-old primigravida presents to the antenatal clinic at 32 weeks gestation for a routine checkup. Her symphysiofundal height (SFH) is 28 cm. Her ultrasound findings show reduced liquor and small abdominal circumference for gestational age. Which of the following investigations will confirm small for gestational age?
A 30-year-old primigravida presents to the obstetrician in the 34th week of pregnancy. Hb electrophoresis reveals the presence of HbS. What fetal complication may occur?

A 30-year-old primigravida, 32 weeks pregnant, attended the antenatal clinic for her routine checkup, her symphysis fundal height (SFH) is 28 cm and her ultrasound showed reduced liquor and small abdominal circumference for gestational age. Which of the following investigations would you request to confirm small head for gestational age?

A 30-year-old woman in her 30th week of gestation has a blood pressure of 150/100 mm of Hg. On investigation, she has no proteinuria and her cardiotocography (CTG) is reactive. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Normal physiologic blood pressure in pregnancy

question: A 30-year-old woman is diagnosed with hyperthyroidism. Further investigations reveal that a mass in the ovary is responsible for her condition. What is the most likely pathology?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the gynecology outpatient department with amenorrhea for 2 months and light vaginal bleeding for 3 days. She also complains of morning sickness. Her vitals are stable, and abdominal examination reveals a single alive fetus of 9 weeks with positive cardiac activity on ultrasound. What is the most probable management option?
A 30-year-old woman recently underwent a total hysterectomy for a complete mole. What is the most appropriate laboratory investigation for a regular follow-up?

A 30-year-old woman, P2+0, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of a finger-like growth around her introitus since the last 6 months which has gradually increased in size. It is also associated with watery foul smelling vaginal discharge on and off. On examination, a diagnosis of genital warts is made. Which of the following is not a probable management option?

answers.option: Screening for other STIs, cervical cancer, partner screening followed by treatment
Ablative therapies, i.e. liquid nitrogen or surgical techniques

question: A 30-year-old woman, P2+0, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of a finger-like growth around her introitus since the last 6 months which has gradually increased in size. It is also associated with watery foul smelling vaginal discharge on and off. On examination, a diagnosis of genital warts is made. Which of the following is the most probable management option?

answers.option: Screening for other STIs, cervical cancer, partner screening followed by treatment.
Ablative therapies, i.e. liquid nitrogen or surgical techniques

question: A 30-year-old woman, gravida 3 para 1+1, presents for her first antenatal booking at 6 weeks of gestation. She has a history of Rhesus isoimmunization. The baby's father is Rh positive. What should be the next step in the management?

answers.option: Monitoring antibody levels every 2–4 weeks from booking.
Recommend genetic counseling to assess the risk of Rhesus isoimmunization in the current pregnancy
Initiate early administration of Rh immunoglobulin
Ultrasound to assess the viability of the fetus
Prescribe a prenatal vitamin supplement with an emphasis on folic acid intake

question: A 30-year-old, P0+0, is brought to the emergency department with a complaint of lower abdominal pain for 2 days which has worsened and a brief spell of unconsciousness at home. Her pulse is 130 beats/minute, blood pressure is 80/40 mmHg. Abdomen is tender on palpation and some fullness is felt. Her last menstrual period was 35 days back. Her urine pregnancy test is positive. Immediate resuscitation with intravenous fluid is started and her ultrasound pelvis shows a uterus of 7x5x3.5 cm with an endometrial thickness of 0.8 cm. Moderate to significant fluid is seen in the pelvis and peritoneal cavity. A heterogeneous area of about 5x4x3 cm is seen in the right adnexa adjacent to the ovary. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option?

A 31-year-old female, P3+1, presents to the outpatient department with a history of cessation of menstruation for the last 3 years. All of her deliveries are normal vaginal deliveries and her last birth was 3 years ago with a history of cervical tears for which she had received multiple transfusions. Her last miscarriage was 4 years ago with a history of dilatation and evacuation. On examination, she is an obese female with a body mass index of 26 Kg/m2, enlarged thyroid, and pallor positive. Her ultrasound pelvis shows a normal uterus and ovaries. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

A 31-year-old female, para 3+1 comes to the emergency department with a history of three months of amenorrhea followed by heavy vaginal bleeding and lower abdominal pain for 1 day. On examination, the pulse is 90 beats per minute, BP is 100/60 mmHg, and the abdomen is soft. On vaginal examination, she is passing blood clots and the cervical os is open. On ultrasound, the uterus is 12 weeks in size. The given presentation best corresponds to which one of the following?

A 31-year-old nulliparous lady comes to a gynecology clinic with the complaint of inability to conceive for the last 6 years and delayed and irregular menstrual cycles for the last 5 years. Her last menstrual period (LMP) was 6 weeks back. Her urine pregnancy test is performed which is negative. Her medical and surgical history is unremarkable. Her body mass index is 27 Kg/m2. On bimanual pelvic examination, the cervix is normal, the uterus is normal size, the fornices clear, no tenderness, and no discharge. Which of the following is the possible contributing factor to her subfertility?

A 31-year-old, G2 P1, the woman at 40 weeks of gestation has progressed in labor from 4 cm to 7 cm cervical dilation over 5 hours. In the next 3 hours, her cervical dilation remains the same that is 7 cm and so does the station having optimum uterine contractions. The fetal hearts heard are reassuring. Which of the following best describes the labor?

A 32 years old Mrs. XYZ, visits the antenatal clinic at 10 weeks of pregnancy for booking. She has 4 children, all delivered vaginally. The last child was 4 kg and was admitted to the nursery. She complains of excessive thirst. You request a random glucose test, which comes out to be 220 mg/dl. Which one of the following is the best management of this patient?

answers.option: Home blood sugar monitoring, and glucophage
Admit, blood sugar charting, and glucophage
Admit, blood sugar charting, diet, exercise, and insulin

question: A 32-year-old female gravida 7 para 6+0 presents to the emergency department with complaints of abdominal pain and per vaginal bleeding. She is 34 weeks pregnant. On examination, the symphysis-fundal height is 36 cm, her abdomen is tense and tender, and fetal heart sound is absent. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female patient is seen in the clinic with genital sores, which are painless and well-circumscribed. Examination shows lymphadenopathy in the associated nodes. A swab was taken and microscopy was performed. It showed cork-screw-shaped bacilli under dark-field microscopy. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 32-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in her left breast. On examination, she is afebrile and a mass is palpable on her left breast. Biopsy of the lesion reveals an enlarged terminal duct lobular unit with compression and distortion of the acini. The acini are arranged in a swirling pattern. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis based on the histological findings on biopsy?
A 32-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of painful breasts. Her history is significant for smoking. Which of the following key feature is related to her diagnosis?

answers.option: Atrophic ducts and lobules with thickened basement membranes

question: A 32-year-old female presents with a palpable 4 cm lump in her breast. On mammography, microcalcifications are identified. On biopsy, proliferation of epithelial cells limited to ducts and lobules by the basement membrane is observed. These ducts have a central area of necrosis and the epithelial cells have pleomorphic, high-grade nuclei and mitotic activity. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female, P2+0, presented to the antenatal clinic at 4 months of pregnancy with complaints of weakness and shortness of breath for the past two weeks. On examination, she appears pale. You requested a CBC, which shows: Hb: 8 g/dl (11-14.4), MCV: 70 fl (78.1-95.3), MCH: 22 pg (25.3-31.7), and MCHC: 28 g/dl (30.3-34.4). The peripheral film shows hypochromic, microcytic red blood cells (RBCs). Which is the most appropriate next investigation?

A 32-year-old lady comes to the outpatient department, she has a parity of 3, known case of diabetes for 2 years, and is currently on drug therapy. She has a history of one anomalous baby which was an intrauterine death. She wishes to take information for conception but is afraid due to the previous baby. Which investigation will suggest at this time to check for the possibility of anomaly?

A 32-year-old medical student is referred to your clinic with an ultrasound report showing a large right ovarian cyst measuring about 10 cm in diameter. The cyst is removed surgically and sent for histopathology. Cysts are unilocular and contain serous fluid. Microscopy shows a cyst lined by a single layer of columnar ciliated epithelium. Which of the following statements is true regarding this patient?

answers.option: Large solid areas are often found in this tumor
Most likely diagnosis is mucinous cyst adenocarcinoma
Serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma is implicated in pathogenesis
This tumor is classified as a surface epithelial tumor

question: A 32-year-old pregnant female at 34 weeks gestation presents to the emergency room with sudden onset abdominal pain and mild vaginal bleeding. On examination, her blood pressure is measured at 60/20, pulse rate is 140, and fetal heart sounds are absent. What complication has she likely gone into?

A 32-year-old pregnant female, gravida 4 para 3+0, presents to the emergency department with sudden, severe abdominal pain. On examination, there is no uterine contour palpable, and fetal heart sounds (FHS) are absent. She had a previous classical uterine incision. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?

A 32-year-old pregnant woman at 38 weeks gestation presents to the emergency room with sudden onset abdominal pain and mild vaginal bleeding. She was previously healthy during her pregnancy, but now her blood pressure is dropping, and fetal heart sounds are becoming faint on continuous fetal monitoring (CTG). Which of the following is the most likely cause of her condition?

A 32-year-old woman has just delivered her baby vaginally. The placenta was expelled spontaneously, and there were no apparent injuries during the delivery. However, she is now experiencing postpartum haemorrhage with continuous bleeding, last estimated as 700ml. Which of the following investigations should be considered for this patient?

answers.option: Coagulation profile to evaluate for any clotting abnormalities
Complete blood count (CBC) to assess for anemia and blood loss
Pelvic ultrasound to assess for retained placental fragments
Doppler ultrasound to evaluate uterine blood flow

question: A 32-year-old woman married for five years, G4P2+1, presented to you in the outpatient department at 26 weeks of pregnancy with an ultrasound report showing oligohydramnios. Which of the following cause has the worst prognosis?

A 32-year-old woman para 2+0, last born six months back, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of amenorrhea for three months. She has a history of irregular periods for six months and weight gain for five months. She is breastfeeding her baby. Her BMI is normal. Which investigation will you advise her?

A 32-year-old woman presented to the clinic with 38 weeks of amenorrhea. Her past medical history was significant for an intrauterine death at term for a female baby that weighed 3.8 kilograms. The doctor ordered baseline tests and her random blood sugar came out to be 188 mg/dl. Which of the following tests will aid in assessing the patient's risk of fetal loss?
A 32-year-old woman presents with intermenstrual bleeding (IMB), and subfertility. A 2 cm endometrial polyp is seen on pelvic ultrasound. What is the most appropriate next step in the management?

answers.option: Prescribe hormonal contraceptives for endometrial stabilization

question: A 32-year-old woman with early-stage estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer requires treatment. You elect to start therapy with a selective estrogen receptor modulator that exerts its effects by binding to and inhibiting the estrogen receptor expressed in breast tumor cells. Which medication will you prescribe for this patient?

A 32-year-old woman, parity 3+0, came to the gynecology clinic as she has had amenorrhea for six months. She has had severe headaches on and off for four months, and her last born is five years ago. Her pregnancy test is negative. Her serum prolactin level is raised. The progesterone challenge test is negative. The most common cause of hyperprolactinemia causing secondary amenorrhea is:

A 32-year-old, P2+0, came in OPD with a complaint of irregular menstrual cycles for the last six months. Her ultrasound pelvis shows an endometrial polyp of 3 x 3 cm. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option for this patient?

A 33-year-old female comes with complaints of itching, discharge, and polypoidal growth on the vulva. On microscopic examination, there is a benign papillomatous squamous proliferation with a fibrovascular core. Keratinocytes show koilocytic changes. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 33-year-old female is a known case of hypertension, G6P3+2, unbooked case, presented to you in the emergency department at 33 weeks of gestation with a complaint of absent fetal cardiac activity. On examination, her BMI is 32 kg/m2, blood pressure is 150/100 mmHg, pulse 90 beats per minute, temperature 98.6F. On abdominal examination, her abdomen is soft, non-tender, symphysiofundal height is 28 cm, lie is longitudinal, and presenting part is cephalic with reducing liquor on palpation. There is no pervaginal bleeding and pain at the moment. What do you think is the cause of intrauterine fetal demise in this patient?

A 33-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of an inability to conceive for the past 3 years despite regular unprotected intercourse. She also complains of recurrent lower abdominal bleeding and dyspareunia. What is the gold-standard investigation for establishing a diagnosis is this condition?

A 34 weeks pregnant female presents to the antenatal clinic for her regular checkup. Her prior antenatal workup reviews hemoglobin electrophoresis for sickle-cell disease. What fetal complication can most likely occur?
A 34-year-old lady developed a vaginal fistula as a result of prolonged labor. What is the most common location where vaginal fistula develops?

answers.option: Between vagina and urethra and bladder

question: A 34-year-old male underwent a bilateral orchiectomy for a paratesticular mass, and histopathological analysis reveals sheets of pale cells with clear cytoplasm and central nuclei. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 34-year-old multigravida mother presented with labor pain at 30 weeks of gestational age. Her pregnancy was complicated by uncontrolled gestational diabetes and pregnancy-induced hypertension. She delivered a baby boy of 1.9 kg via SVD with an APGAR score of 5 and 8 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. Thirty minutes after birth, the baby developed loud grunting associated with marked nasal flaring and chest retractions. Work-up in NICU showed severe respiratory distress syndrome. What is the most appropriate treatment for this baby?

A 34-year-old primigravida female delivers a healthy term baby vaginally and enters the third stage of labor. She delivers a complete placenta with a loss of 700 ml of blood. What investigation should be ordered in this case?

A 34-year-old primigravida is undergoing an elective cesarean section due to breech presentation. Following delivery, the newborn shows signs of tachypnea. What is the appropriate management for the neonate?

answers.option: Transfer the baby to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU)
Encourage breastfeeding to promote natural lung expansion

question: A 34-year-old woman (gravida 4, para 3) at 38½ weeks, whose pregnancy is complicated by gestational diabetes, is in labor. The head delivers, but the shoulders do not follow. An efficacious method of delivery for shoulder dystonia includes the McRoberts maneuver. This maneuver is described as which of the following?

answers.option: Rotation into an oblique position after delivery of posterior arm
Rotation of posterior shoulder to anterior

question: A 34-year-old woman passes away after a spontaneous vaginal delivery due to postpartum hemorrhage. What is the cause of maternal mortality in this case scenario?

A 34-year-old woman presents with severe abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. She had amenorrhea for 3 months. Her ultrasound shows a dilated fallopian tube. A provisional diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy is made. What can be expected on microscopy of the tube?

answers.option: Dilated tube with chorionic villi and decidua
Hemorrhage necrosis and sheets of trophoblasts with atypia and mitosis
Large swollen villi with trophoblastic proliferation
Intermediate trophoblasts and a well-developed placenta

question: A 34-year-old woman, para 4, all spontaneous vaginal deliveries, comes into the outpatient department with complaints of off-and-on vaginal discharge along with perineal area itching and superficial dyspareunia. On examination of the vulva, a hyperpigmented and bullous lesion is seen. What could be the most probable diagnosis of this condition on inspection?

A 35-year-old Mrs. Gulzar, P3+0, last born 2 months back, known hypertensive for 5 years, has a history of heavy menstrual bleeding for 18 months. She is also breastfeeding her child. She comes to the gynaecology outpatient department to take advice on the use of some sort of long-acting contraceptive (LARC) method to avoid unintended pregnancy. What is the most effective method of LARC, keeping in view her medical problems?
A 35-year-old female is diagnosed with lobular carcinoma. What is the hallmark of this tumor?

answers.option: Amplification of HER2 gene on chromosome 17
Biallelic loss of expression of CDH1 gene

question: A 35-year-old female patient comes to the gynecology outpatient department to discuss the ideal method to avoid pregnancy with better compliance. Her doctor decides to give her injectable contraceptive depot medroxyprogesterone acetate. Which of the following is the most common and important undesirable effect of injectable contraceptive depot medroxyprogesterone acetate?

A 35-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of dyspnea and early fatigability. She reports a history of heavy menstrual bleeding for one year. On examination, her uterus was of normal size, and no abnormality was noted. On transvaginal ultrasound, there was no pelvic abnormality. Her CBC showed haemoglobin of 7.5 g/dl. She has two children and does not want to conceive at present. Which of the following is the most appropriate management for this patient?

A 35-year-old female presents to the emergency room with 8 weeks of amenorrhea with a positive urine pregnancy test. Transvaginal ultrasound shows no intrauterine pregnancy and normal adnexa. Her serum beta HCG levels are 1500 IU/L. She is vitally stable. What is the most appropriate diagnosis for this patient?

A 35-year-old female undergoes surgery for a large ovarian cyst. The cyst is unilocular and contains cheesy material, hair, and teeth. Microscopically it is lined by skin with sebaceous glands and hair follicles. Other areas show mature fatty tissue, cartilage, and thyroid follicles. No primitive tissue is seen. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 35-year-old female, who is a smoker, presents with a painful breast. On examination, there is a palpable breast mass associated with skin dimpling and nipple retraction. She reports occasional bloody nipple discharge. Which of the following is a key morphological feature of her condition?

answers.option: Keratinizing squamous metaplasia of lactiferous ducts

question: A 35-year-old lady consults her gynecologist with a complaint of irregular spotting between her menstrual cycles for the past 6 months. Examination under anesthesia (EUA) and biopsy reveal a cervical polyp measuring 2 cm. What is the treatment?

A 35-year-old lady undergoes surgery for a large ovarian cyst. The cyst is unilocular and contains cheesy material, hair, and teeth. Microscopically, it is lined by skin with sebaceous glands and hair follicles. Other areas show mature fatty tissue, cartilage, and thyroid follicles. No primitive tissue is seen. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 35-year-old male patient comes to the clinic with a complaint of heaviness in his scrotal region for six to seven months. On physical examination, he has enlarged left testis. Laboratory reports show elevated AFP = 82 ng/ml, HCG = 15 IU/L. His ultrasound reveals 6 cm mass in left testis. Excisional biopsy is performed. Histopathology reports exhibit cords and sheets of undifferentiated cells with enlarged nuclei and primitive glandular pattern. Which of the following most probable diagnosis?

A 35-year-old male presented to a subfertility clinic. Investigations reveal the pH of semen as 7.4, a volume of 2.0 ml, a total sperm count of 34 x 10^6/ml, progressive motility of 5%, and sperm morphology of 8%. What is the abnormality seen in this semen report?

A 35-year-old obese woman conceives for the first time following treatment for infertility. She is taking multivitamins. Ultrasound examination reveals twin pregnancy, She is concerned about delivering prematurely. Which of the following factors in this woman is the most likely to lead to preterm delivery?

A 35-year-old unbooked patient comes to the outpatient department at 26 weeks gestation for antenatal booking. On examination height of the fundus is 32 weeks, lie is longitudinal, breech presentation, fetal heart sounds are present and liquor is excessive. What investigation is advised?

A 35-year-old woman came to gynaecology out-patient-department with a complaint of inability to conceive. She has been married for 5 years. Her husband is 38-years-old. Her husband had 2 kids from his first wife. Her body mass index is normal, serum FSH and LH and ultrasound pelvis are all unremarkable. She gives a history of dysmenorrhea and dyspareunia. What is the most important investigation for her?
A 35-year-old woman consults her gynecologist with the complaint of postcoital bleed. On examination, a red colored mass is seen protruding from the vagina. What is the diagnosis?

A 35-year-old woman had a ruptured membrane at the 30th week of gestation. She developed a fever of 38.5 degrees and elevated C-reactive protein (CRP) levels. What is the most likely complication of this condition?
A 35-year-old woman is experiencing infertility due to anovulation. Which agent is most appropriate for this patient?

A 35-year-old woman, known case of diabetes mellitus type 2, delivered a baby boy at 30 weeks of gestation. The newborn requires oxygen support. What is the condition he is most likely suffering from?

answers.option: Persistent pulmonary hypertension of the newborn

question: A 35-year-old woman, para 2, presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and dysuria. Her abdominal examination is unremarkable. The transvaginal scan is normal. On per vaginal examination, there is tenderness in the pouch of Douglas with retroverted fixed uterus and thickening of the uterosacral ligament. What should be the most appropriate treatment for this patient?

A 35-year-old, para 0+3, presents to the emergency department with right iliac fossa pain and vomiting for 12 hours. Her last menstrual period was 33 days ago. The uterus is enlarged and the cervix is soft. Ultrasound shows 4x4 right adnexal mass. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 36-year-old lady presents with vaginal bleeding after 2 months of amenorrhea. The gynecologist suspects gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD). Which of the following is not a GTD?

A 36-year-old lady, G6P5+1, who previously had all normal deliveries, delivered a live female baby of a weight of 4 kg. After delivery of the placenta, she starts bleeding heavily. On palpation, the uterus was found to be soft and boggy so uterine massage was done and uterotonics were also administered, but her bleeding did not settle. What is the next step in the management of this patient?

A 36-year-old nulliparous woman presents with a twin pregnancy. She is taking her multivitamins regularly. She is concerned about premature delivery. Which of the following is the most important risk factor for premature labor in her case?

A 36-year-old unbooked female comes to the emergency department at 2 am with a history of spontaneous twin vaginal delivery 3 hours back at home followed by heavy vaginal bleeding. This is her fourth pregnancy with all previous normal vaginal deliveries. On arrival, she is semi-conscious with cold clammy skin and extremely pale in look. Her BP is 80/40 mmHg and her pulse is 132 beats/min. On abdominal examination, a boggy, relaxed uterus of 26 weeks size is palpable, and on vaginal examination, heavy vaginal bleeding is noticed. What should be the most immediate next step in her management?

A 36-year-old unbooked female presents to the emergency department at 2 am with a history of a home spontaneous twin vaginal delivery 3 hours back followed by heavy vaginal bleeding. This is her fourth pregnancy with previous normal vaginal deliveries. On arrival, the patient is semiconscious, extremely pale looking with cold clammy skin. Her BP is 80/40 mmHg and her pulse is 132 beats per minute. On abdominal examination, a boggy, relaxed uterus of 26 weeks size is palpable, and on vaginal examination, heavy vaginal bleeding is noticed. What should be the most immediate next step in her management?
A 36-year-old woman requests birth control. She has no medical conditions, and she smokes one pack of cigarettes per day. Which would be the most appropriate recommendation?

A 36-year-old woman, G4P2+1, with a history of spontaneous vaginal deliveries at 33 and 35 weeks gestation presents to the OPD at 14 weeks gestation for routine follow-up. Her last pregnancy resulted in a miscarriage at 17 weeks. Which of the following tests should be performed in this case?

A 36-year-old woman, G4P2+1, with a history of spontaneous vaginal deliveries at 33 and 35 weeks gestation presents to the outpatient department at 14 weeks gestation for routine follow-up. Her last pregnancy had resulted in a miscarriage at 17 weeks. Ultrasound report shows a single intrauterine fetus and a cervical length of 21 mm. Which of the following is the appropriate management plan?

A 37-year-old female presented to the outpatient department with complaints of severe dysmenorrhea and menorrhagia for the past two months. Localized hypoechoic areas are seen in the myometrium. What is your diagnosis?

A 37-year-old lady G4 P3+0, previously having all normal deliveries, known case of diabetes, presents in the outpatient department for a routine antenatal visit at 33 weeks of gestation. She has a history of intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) fetus in her previous pregnancy. On examination, her vitals are within normal range. On abdominal examination, her symphysio-fundal height is 30 cm with a fetal heart rate of 132 beats per minute. Her uterus shows a fetus of 30 weeks, decreased amniotic fluid volume, and doppler studies showed mild placental insufficiency. What is the most significant risk factor in her history leading to this condition?

answers.option: History of IUGR in previous pregnancy

question: A 38-week-old male infant weighing 2.8 kg has just been born via LSCS and brought to NICU within 45 minutes with difficulty in breathing and grunting since birth. On examination, RR of 65/min and HR of 150/min with mild subcostal recession and peripheral cyanosis is observed. S1 and S2 are audible with no added sound. Chest X-ray shows fluid in a fissure. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 38-year-old female presented with serious third-trimester bleeding requiring emergency C-section. She had placental implantation in the cervix, with the placenta invading less than half of the myometrium. What is the name of this condition?

A 38-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of absence of menstruation for the past 18 months. She also reports a decline in her libido. On pelvic examination, dryness of the vulva and vagina can be appreciated. Which of the following findings will likely be present in this patient?

A 38-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of absence of menstruation for the past 6 months. She also complains of dryness and itching around her vagina. Which of the following is likely to be present in this patient?

A 38-year-old male presents with a unilateral painless palpable mass in the left testis. His serum alpha-fetoprotein and beta hcg levels are normal with mild lactate dehydrogenase elevation. On microscopic examination, it is composed of sheets of large monotonous cells with rounded nuclei with prominent nucleoli and eosinophilic cytoplasm.
