A 38-year-old nulliparous patient complains of bleeding between her periods and increasingly heavy menses. Over the past 9 months, she has had oral contraceptives and anti-prostaglandins which have not decreased the abnormal bleeding. Which of the following option is best for this patient?

answers.option: Perform a D and C procedure under general anesthesia
Start the patient on high-dose progesterone agent

question: A 38-year-old nulliparous patient complains of heavy bleeding between her periods and increasingly heavier periods. Over the past nine months, she has had oral contraceptive pills (OCPs) and anti-prostaglandins, which have not reduced the bleeding. What is the next best step?

A 38-year-old patient presented in a gynecology clinic with complaints of frequent urination and nocturia. She was diagnosed with an overactive bladder. Her body mass index was 26 kg/m2 and the patient does not want to take any medicines. Which of the following is the most important lifestyle change that should be recommended to her?

A 38-year-old patient presented to the gynecology clinic with complaints of frequency of urine, urgency, and nocturia since her last birth 2 years ago. Abdominal examination is unremarkable. Her BMI is 26 kg/m². Her urine D/R shows leucocytes 2-4/HPF. Which of the following is the most important lifestyle change recommended for her?

A 38-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge that is brown in color. She also gives a history of a miscarriage that happened one year ago. On pelvic examination, lumps are felt in the uterus, a biopsy of which reveals proliferating syncytiotrophoblasts and cytotrophoblasts. There are no chorionic villi identified. This tumor also has a high propensity to metastasize to the brain and liver. Which of the following is appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: It has an excellant prognosis after evacuation and chemotherapy
It has a really poor prognosis after diagnosis
It needs continuous alpha fetoprotein level monitoring
The most common site for it's metastasis is the brain
The ovarian form of this tumor is less aggresive

question: A 38-year-old, para 2+2, presents at 10 weeks of pregnancy in an antenatal clinic. The patient gives the history of only one live child. Her second child was diagnosed as having Down syndrome and died at the age of 5 years. She is very anxious and wants to know if she is carrying a baby with Down syndrome again. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic test for her?

A 39-year-old male patient presents in the outpatient department with a history of high-grade fever and painful testicular swelling. answers.option: Oral antibiotics for both chlamydia and gonococcal infection as per WHO guidelines
Immediate exploration to rule out testicular torsion

question: A 39-year-old nulliparous female, married for 5 years presents with painful menstruation for 6 years. The pain increases with the duration of the menstrual cycle and is maximum at the end of the cycle. Her ultrasound pelvis shows a left-sided ovarian cyst of dimensions 6 cm x 4 cm. A 4-day-old baby delivered by cesarean section was brought to the ICU with a complaint of fever and reluctance to feed for 2 days. A 4-year-old female is brought by her parents to the clinic due to early bilateral development of breasts. There is no history of headaches or vision problems. A 4-year-old girl presents with a grape-like mass protruding from her vagina. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female, para 4+0, comes to the outpatient department with a history of irregular per vaginal bleeding for 1 year. On examination, a fleshy growth is seen protruding from the cervix. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old woman undergoes surgery for an ovarian mass, and the pathology report reveals struma ovarii. This tumour is histologically composed predominantly of which type of tissue?

A 41-year-old female presents to the clinic with regular and heavy menstrual bleeding. She has four children and does not want any more pregnancies. On examination, her uterus is normal in size, mobile, and non-tender. What is the best management option for this patient?

A 42-year-old female comes with complaints of itching, discharge, and polypoidal growth on the vulva. On microscopic examination, there is a benign papillomatous growth composed of mature squamous cells with raisinoid nuclei with a clear halo around nuclei. What is the most probable cause?

question: A 52-year-old, who is a mother of 6, presents to your clinic with a palpable mass just under the areola of her breast. She complains of thick, whitish secretions from her nipple. answers.option: Usually occurs in young lactating mothers
Squamous metaplasia of ducts is a prominent feature

answers.option: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

answers.option: Initiate a low-fat diet to reduce estrogen levels

question: A 55-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of something protruding out of her vagina for the past 5 years. She is parity 4+0 and her last child was born 18 years ago. question: A 60-year-old female is diagnosed with bilateral adenocarcinoma of the ovaries. On histopathology and radiology, both tumors are confirmed as independent primary tumors. Which of the following tumors has highest chances of bilateral presentation?

answers.option: Surgery is required after 2 years of age
Surgery should be performed around one year of age

A 70-year-old woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of an increase in the frequency of micturition and excessive bloating. On pelvic examination, a mass can be felt. answers.option: It is associated with pseudomyxoma peritonei
Low parity is a risk reducing factor
Most likely to occur during the ages of 40-59

question: A 75-year-old female presents to the clinic with a mass on her vulva. On examination, the mass measures 1 cm in diameter. What is the appropriate stage?
A 75-year-old female presents with a mass on the vulval region extending to the lower 5 mm of the urethra. Biopsy proves vulval carcinoma. What is the best treatment option?

A 75-year-old woman presents with abdominal distention and a history of weight loss in the last three months. Her pelvic ultrasound shows a solid ovarian mass. Which of the following is the commonest ovarian tumor at this age?

A G5 P4+0 is referred to a clinic at 35 weeks of pregnancy with laboratory reports showing platelets 35000/mm3 and increased transaminases. Her blood pressure is 180/130 mmHg. The most probable cause of low platelets would be which of the following?

A baby born at 38 weeks of gestation, and having a good APGAR score is being assessed in the delivery room. On examination, the baby has a symmetrically low birth weight, height, and head circumference. The baby is erythematous and jittery, but the remaining systemic examination is normal. A baby in a longitudinal lie is being delivered. On vaginal examination, the presenting part is soft. What is the most likely presentation?
A baby is blue, grimacing, a heart rate of 120 beats/minute, respiration is with effort, and some flexion. What is the APGAR score?

A baby is born at 35 weeks of gestational age and the weight of the baby is between the 10th and 90th centile expected for his gestational age. How will you classify this baby's gestational age and weight?

answers.option: Preterm and normal for gestational age
Term and small for gestational age
Preterm and small for gestational age
Term and large for gestational age
Post term and normal for gestational age

question: A baby is born at term weighing 3 kg. The mother is concerned that she does not have enough milk. What will be the appropriate advice for her?

answers.option: Give parenteral nutrition to the baby
Reassure/ advise to continue breast feeding

question: A baby is born with meconium staining on his skin. He shows good respiratory effort and has a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute. What is the best initial management?

answers.option: Intubation and suctioning, bag mask ventilation

question: A baby is considered stillborn when it is born after how many weeks?

A breastfeeding woman is taking oral contraceptives. After a few months, she notices some hair growing on her face and acne. Which one of the following drugs is responsible for causing these symptoms?

A child gets injured and is brought to the outpatient department for a checkup of his skin wound. You clean the wound and administer prophylaxis against tetanus since he has never been vaccinated against tetanus before. What prophylaxis will be appropriate for this patient?

answers.option: Tetanus immunoglobulin and first dose of tetanus toxoid

question: A child presented to the clinic with his head circumference and his upper and lower limb growth at less than 10th percentile. In which of the following categories is the child classified?

A child presents to the clinic with sunken eyes. On examination, the skin pinch goes back slowly and the child is eager to drink when offered water. How will the dehydration be classified according to IMNCI?

A child presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of cough, increased breathing rate, irritability, costal recessions, and chest indrawings. He is unable to feed and has now developed convulsions. What is the probable diagnosis according to the IMNCI?

question: A condition in which the reproductive process is accomplished in a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being and is not merely the absence of disease or disorder of the reproductive process. Which of the following terms is best described by this definition?
A condition in which the uterus appears larger than the expected gestational age. On ultrasound, it shows cystic masses and the absence of fetal tissues. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A couple comes to the clinic after 4 days of having unprotected sex. They do not plan to conceive. What is the best emergency contraceptive measure?

answers.option: Contains 80% water; no need to give water to the baby

Higher ratio of casein: whey so better absorption

question: A couple is attending a follow-up in a gynecology clinic with a complaint of inability to conceive since 5 years of their marriage. answers.option: Intracytoplasmic sperm injection with in vitro fertilization

question: A couple married for 3 years is unable to consummate the marriage. The female experiences superficial dyspareunia and apprehension. She has regular menstrual cycles. What is the likely cause?

A couple presents to a high-risk outpatient department for early pregnancy counseling. Both partners are beta-thalassemia minor and this is their first conception. answers.option: 25% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling
50% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling
10% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling

question: A couple presents to the clinic with a concern that they are unable to find one testis of their newborn. A couple presents to the clinic with a history of subfertility for 2 years. The wife's hormonal profile and ultrasound scan are normal. The husband's semen analysis shows a sperm concentration of 5 million per mL, sperms/ejaculate of 4 million, progressive motility of 10%, and normal morphology of 2%. A demographer wants to predict the actual number of population after 20 years, which one of the following measures of fertility would be appropriate for the projection of population?
